channel.title: C on Txominpelu Github Pages
channel.description: Recent content in C on Txominpelu Github Pages

item.title: Cgo
item.description: What is cgo ? Cgo is go’s FFI for C. This means that with Cgo you can call C code from Go and viceversa. How does it work ? Two languages can talk to each other whenever they share a communication channel. For example a not so efficient implementation of FFI can be done through RPC. However both C and Go are languages that compile to machine code (in opposition to vm languages like Java).
